conclusion: Parallel-plate capacitor with capacitance C, charge Q, distance d, and point charge q at midpoint.
Electric field between plates is E = Q/(Cd).
Electrostatic force on charge q is F = q * (Q/(Cd)).
Left plate has positive charge and right plate has negative charge.
Direction of force depends on sign of q: toward negative plate if q is positive, toward positive plate if q is negative.
Magnitude of electrostatic force on point charge q is F = qQ/(Cd).
